item.title: Jude add a quote by John Crowley
item.description: "The things that make us happy make us wise. " -- John Crowley

item.title: Jude add a quote by Isak Dinesen
item.description: "Through all the world there goes one long cry from the heart of the artist: Give me a chance to do my best. " -- Isak Dinesen

item.title: Jude add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "This is. And thou art. There is no safety. There is no end. The word must be heard in silence. There must be darkness to see the stars. The dance is always danced above the hollow place, above the terrible abyss." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Jude add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "Do nothing because it is righteous or praiseworthy or noble to do so; do nothing because it seems good to do so; do only that which you must do and which you cannot do in any other way." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Jude add a quote by Kate Braverman
item.description: "Just being in a room with myself is almost more stimulation than I can bear." -- Kate Braverman

item.title: Jude add a quote by Antonio Machado
item.description:
"Wanderer, your footsteps are the road, and nothing more; wanderer, there is no road, the road is made by walking. By walking one makes the road, and upon glancing behind one sees the path that never will be trod again. Wanderer, there is no road-- Only wakes upon the sea.
Caminante, son tus huellas el camino, y nada más; caminante, no hay camino, se hace camino al andar. Al andar se hace camino, y al volver la vista atrás se ve la senda que nunca se ha de volver a pisar. Caminante, no hay camino, sino estelas en la mar." -- Antonio Machado

item.title: Jude add a quote by Kathleen Barry
item.description: "They are not afraid of what we are against, they are afraid of what we are for. What we are for is so much more powerful than what we are against." -- Kathleen Barry

item.title: Jude add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "When I dare to be powerful, to use my strength in the service of my vision, then it becomes less and less important whether I am afraid." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Jude add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "The master's tools will never dismantle the master's house" -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Jude add a quote by Muriel Rukeyser
item.description:
"Wherever we walk we will make
Wherever we protest we will go planting
Make poems seed grass feed a child growing build a house Whatever we stand against We will stand feeding and seeding
Wherever I walk I will make" -- Muriel Rukeyser

item.title: Jude add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description:
"The Heart is the Capital of the Mind— The Mind is a single State— The Heart and the Mind together make A single Continent—
One—is the Population— Numerous enough— This ecstatic Nation Seek—it is Yourself." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Jude add a quote by Adrienne Rich
item.description: "The unconscious wants truth. It ceases to speak to those who want something else more than truth." -- Adrienne Rich

item.title: Jude add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "I know, but I do not approve. And I am not resigned." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Jude add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The liar's punishment is, not in the least that he is not believed, but that he cannot believe anyone else." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jude add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jude add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Power does not corrupt men; fools, however, if they get into a position of power, corrupt power." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jude add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Patriotism is, fundamentally, a conviction that a particular country is the best in the world because you were born in it...." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jude add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jude add a quote by Louise Gluck
item.description:
"The Red Poppy
The great thing is not having a mind. Feelings: oh, I have those; they govern me. I have a lord in heaven called the sun, and open for him, showing him the fire of my own heart, fire like his presence. What could such glory be if not a heart? Oh my brothers and sisters, were you like me once, long ago, before you were human? Did you permit yourselves to open once, who would never open again? Because in truth I am speaking now the way you do. I speak because I am shattered." -- Louise Gluck

item.title: Jude add a quote by Louise Gluck
item.description:
"17. The self ended and the world began. They were of equal size, commensurate, one mirrored the other.
18. The riddle was: why couldn't we live in the mind.
The answer was: the barrier of the earth intervened.
" -- Louise Gluck

item.title: Jude add a quote by Robert Bolt
item.description: "If we lived in a state where virtue was profitable, common sense would make us saintly. But since we see that avarice, anger, pride and stupidity commonly profit far beyond charity, modesty, justice and thought, perhaps we must stand fast a little, even at the risk of being heroes." -- Robert Bolt

item.title: Jude add a quote by Isak Dinesen
Jude add a quote by John Crowley
item.description: "The further in you go, the bigger it gets." -- John Crowley

item.title: Jude add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Music is the only religion that delivers the goods." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Jude add a quote by Theodore Roethke
item.description:
"<b>The Waking</b>
I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow. I feel my fate in what I cannot fear. I learn by going where I have to go.
We think by feeling. What is there to know? I hear my being dance from ear to ear. I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow.
Of those so close beside me, which are you? God bless the Ground! I shall walk softly there, And learn by going where I have to go.
Light takes the Tree; but who can tell us how? The lowly worm climbs up a winding stair; I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow.
Great Nature has another thing to do To you and me, so take the lively air, And, lovely, learn by going where to go.
This shaking keeps me steady. I should know. What falls away is always. And is near. I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow. I learn by going where I have to go." -- Theodore Roethke

item.title: Jude add a quote by Nawal El Saadawi
item.description: "They said, “You are a savage and dangerous woman.” I am speaking the truth. And the truth is savage and dangerous." -- Nawal El Saadawi

item.title: Jude add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "Out of my flesh that hungers and my mouth that knows comes the shape I am seeking for reason." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Jude add a quote by Novalis
item.description: "Where are we really going? Always home." -- Novalis

item.title: Jude add a quote by Louise Gluck
item.description: "To raise the veil. To see what you're saying goodbye to." -- Louise Gluck

item.title: Jude add a quote by Scott Joplin
item.description:
"Marching onward, marching onward Marching to that lovely tune Marching onward, marching onward Happy as a bird in June
Sliding onward, sliding onward Listen to that rag Hop and skip now do that slow, oh Do that slow drag
Dance slowly, prance slowly Now you hear that pretty rag Dance slowly, prance slowly Now you do the real slow drag
Waltz slowly, waltz slowly Listen to the ragtime Hop and skip Now do the slow, oh, do the slow drag" -- Scott Joplin
